{"step_by_step_thinking": "SARS-CoV-2 is the virus that causes COVID-19. While it is true that getting infected with the virus can lead to the development of antibodies, which can provide some level of protection against future infections, it is also true that this immunity is not absolute and does not last forever. There have been documented cases of reinfection, where individuals who have recovered from COVID-19 have been infected again. Therefore, reinfection can occur after SARS-CoV-2 infection.", "answer_choice": "A"}
